resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/74394</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>74394</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>SDT</catalog>
            <entry>40b2660e-abc4-44c7-2940-c76a70661d7c#1#4</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="hu">Jacopo de' Barbari: Fra Luca Paccioli és tanítványa, 1495, Galleria Nazionale di Capodimonte, Nápoly, olaj, vászon.</string>
            <string language="en">Jacopo de' Barbari: Fra Luca Paccioli and his disciple, 1495, Galleria Nazionale di Capodimonte, Naples, oil, canvas.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Jacopo De ' Barbari: Fra Luca Paccioli und 
sein Schüler, 1495, Galleria Nazionale di Capodimonte, Neapel, Öl, 
Segeltuch.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Jacopo de 'Barbari : ATF Luca Paccioli et 
son disciple, 1495, Galleria Nazionale di Capodimonte, Naples, huile, 
toile.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Jacopo de ' Barbari: Fra Luca Paccioli e 
seu disciple, 1495, Galleria Nazionale di Capodimonte, Nápoles, 
óleo, lona.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Jacopo de 'Barbari: Fra Luca Paccioli ed il 
suo disciple, 1495, Galleria Nazionale di Capodimonte, Napoli, olio, 
tela di canapa.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Jacopo de "Barbari: Fra Λ0ύκα 
Paccioli και ο απόστολός του, 1495, Galleria Nazionale 
Di Capodimonte, Νάπολη, πετρέλαιο, καμβάς.</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Jacopo de ' Barbari: Fra Luca Paccioli y su
discípulo, 1495, Galleria Nazionale di Capodimonte, Nápoles, aceite,
lona.</string>
          </title>
          <language>hu</language>
          <description>
            <string language="hu">A mester, a művész mint alkotó jelenik meg a képen, kezében a humanizmus egyik fontos eszközével, a körzővel mint új világok teremtője.</string>
            <string language="en">The master, the artist appears as author on the painting, and holds compasses, which is one of the important tools of humanism, as creator of new worlds. </string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="hu">mester,  körző,  természet,  15. század,  humanista,  </string>
            <string language="en">master, compasses, nature, 15th century, humanist</string>
          </keyword>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Der Meister, der Künstler erscheint als Autor auf dem 
Anstrich und hält Kompassse, der eins der wichtigen Hilfsmittel von 
Humanismus ist, als Schöpfer der neuen Welten an.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Le maître, l'artiste apparaît comme auteur sur la 
peinture, et tient des boussoles, qui est l'un des outils importants 
de l'humanisme, comme créateur de nouveaux mondes.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">O mestre, o artista aparece como o autor na pintura, e 
prende compassos, que é uma das ferramentas importantes do humanism, 
como o criador de mundos novos.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Il supervisore, l'artista compare come autore sulla 
pittura e tiene le bussole, che è uno degli strumenti importanti di 
humanism, come creatore di nuovi mondi.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ο κύριος, ο καλλιτέχνης εμφανίζεται ως συντάκτης στη 
ζωγραφική, και κρατά τις πυξίδες, που είναι ένα από τα 
σημαντικά εργαλεία του ανθρωπισμού, ως δημιουργός των νέων 
κόσμων.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">El amo, el artista aparece como autor en la pintura, y 
lleva a cabo los compases, que es una de las herramientas importantes 
del humanism, como creador de mundos nuevos.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Meister, Kompassse, Natur, 15. Jahrhundert, Humanist</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">maître, boussoles, nature, 15ème siècle, humaniste</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">mestre, compassos, natureza, 1ö século, humanista</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">supervisore, bussole, natura, quindicesimo secolo, humanist</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">κύριος, πυξίδες, φύση, 15$ος αιώνας, ανθρωπιστής</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">amo, compases, naturaleza, décimo quinto siglo, humanista</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <educational>
          <learningResourceType>
            <source>LRE.learningResourceTypeValues</source>
            <value>image</value>
          </learningResourceType>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <cost>
            <source>costValues</source>
            <value>no</value>
          </cost>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="hu">A tartalom kizárólag kizárólag az oktatás illetve tudományos kutatás céljára használható szigorúan non-profit jelleggel.</string>
            <string language="en">The content may be used for the sole purpose of illustration for teaching or scientific research and only for a strictly non-commercial purpose.</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
        <lifeCycle>

              <value>publisher</value>
            </role>
            <entity>begin:vcard 
version:3.0
n:;
fn: 
org:Nemzeti Tankönyvkiadó Rt.
end:vcard</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <classification>
          <purpose>
            <source>purposeValues</source>
            <value>discipline</value>
          </purpose>
          <taxonPath>

              <string language="x-none">LRE-0001</string>

              <id>591</id>
            </taxon>
          </taxonPath>
        </classification>
        <metaMetadata>

            </role>
            <entity>begin:vcard
        org:Sulinet

        </metaMetadata>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
